sources.data_found: The National Research Platform (NRP, formerly PRP), hosts Nautilus, a ~300-node distributed compute cluster with CPUs, GPUs, and FPGAs designed as a testbed for science drivers to expedite science and enable transformative research.

Total # of CPU threads: 656 Total Amount of RAM: 5.9TB 5 x NVIDIA RTX 6000 ADA GPUs Head Node - Dual Xeon Silver 4216 - 64 threads, 768GB RAM and one NVIDIA RTX A5000 GPU general queue (7 day limit): 2 nodes - EPYC 9754 - 256 threads, 2.25TB

This new UCSD Supercomputer consists of a mix of CPU and GPU nodes. There are 10 1U Xi WebRAIDer for a total of 400-Core Intel Xeon 4316 CPU cluster. One of the 10 systems sports an additional NVIDIA A10 GPU with 9216 CUDA Cores.

All running containers in the cluster have a maximum configuration limit of 8 CPU, 64GB, and 1 GPU. The Research Cluster shares hardware infrastructure with the Data Science and Machine Learning Platform (DSMLP).
NVIDIA DGX Cloud platform...Usage of DGX Cloud is aimed at enabling proposals that can benefit from dedicated access to a 32-node cluster for sustained AI computing campaigns.

student_data.notes: Based on DataUSA statistics showing 518 Computer Science bachelor's degrees awarded at UCSD in 2023. Using standard 4-year program assumption: 518 × 4 = 2,072 undergraduate CS majors. Graduate student counts estimated based on MS/PhD program descriptions indicating approximately 800 total graduate students in CSE department, split evenly between MS (400) and PhD (400) programs as stated on the CSE graduate page. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Part of Xi Computer cluster delivered to UCSD
Head node GPU in SSCF cluster

gpu_resources.notes: Limited GPU data found. SSCF cluster confirmed with 5x NVIDIA RTX 6000 ADA GPUs and 1x RTX A5000. Xi Computer cluster has 1x NVIDIA A10. Research Cluster (DSMLP) allows 1 GPU per container but total GPU count not specified. Nautilus/NRP cluster has ~300 nodes with GPUs but specific models/counts not found. SDSC operates additional GPU resources but specifications not publicly available. Many H100/A100 counts marked as -1 (not found) despite extensive search.

analysis_notes: Data collection was challenging as UCSD distributes GPU resources across multiple facilities (SDSC, Research Cluster/DSMLP, department clusters, Nautilus/NRP) with limited public specifications. Student data derived from degree completion statistics as direct enrollment figures were not found.
